Module college.student_records
Package college.mtu_records

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
college.mtu_records.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class manages the logic for the student record system.

It holds references to the view, student, module, grade and connection objects.

It also maintains lists for students, modules, grades, and list box components.

      Constructor that sets the view and establishes a database connection.
      Parameters:

    • Controller

      public Controller()
      Default constructor for the Controller class. Made to use in tests.

  • Method Details

    • validateStudentName

      public String validateStudentName(String name)
      Validates if the given student name is not empty.
      Parameters:
      name - The student name to validate.
      Returns:
      A validation error message if the name is empty, otherwise null.

    • validateModuleName

      public String validateModuleName(String name)
      Validates if the given module name is not empty.
      Parameters:
      name - The module name to validate.
      Returns:
      A validation error message if the name is empty, otherwise null.

    • validateStudentId

      public String validateStudentId(String id)
      Validates if the given student ID is not empty and follows the required format.
      Parameters:
      id - The student ID to validate.
      Returns:
      A validation error message if the ID is empty or does not follow the required format, otherwise null.

    • validateModuleCode

      public String validateModuleCode(String code)
      Validates if the given module code is not empty and follows the required format.
      Parameters:
      code - The module code to validate.
      Returns:
      A validation error message if the code is empty or does not follow the required format, otherwise null.

    • validateGrade

      public boolean validateGrade(double grade)
      Validates if the given grade is within the acceptable range (0-100).
      Parameters:
      grade - The grade to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the grade is valid, otherwise false.

    • validateDob

      public String validateDob(String dob)
      Validates if the given date of birth is in the correct format and follows the age requirements.
      Parameters:
      dob - The date of birth to validate.
      Returns:
      A validation error message if the date format is incorrect or the age is not within the required range, otherwise null.

    • validateSemester

      public boolean validateSemester(int semester)
      Validates if the given semester value is greater than 10.
      Parameters:
      semester - The semester to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the semester is valid, otherwise false.

    • addStudent

      public void addStudent(javafx.scene.control.TextField name, javafx.scene.control.TextField id, javafx.scene.control.TextField dob, javafx.scene.control.TextField currentSem)
      Adds a new student to the ArrayList and the database if the provided information is valid. It validates the input data, displays a warning message if there are any errors, and adds the student to the database if all input data is valid.
      Parameters:
      name - The TextField containing the student's name.
      id - The TextField containing the student's ID.
      dob - The TextField containing the student's date of birth.
      currentSem - The TextField containing the student's current semester.

    • removeStudent

      public void removeStudent(javafx.scene.control.TextField id)
      Removes a student from the database if the provided student ID is valid. It validates the input student ID, displays a warning message if there are any errors, and removes the student from the database if the input student ID is valid.
      Parameters:
      id - The TextField containing the student's ID to be removed.

    • listStudent

      public void listStudent()
      Lists all students from the database in the list box. Fetches all student records from the database, adds them to the studentsList ArrayList, and displays them in the list box (list1).

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Exits the program after prompting the user to save their changes. Displays a confirmation alert with custom "Yes" and "No" buttons. If the user selects "Yes", the program will exit without saving.

    • submit

      public void submit(String selectedStudent, String selectedModule, javafx.scene.control.TextField gradeInput)
      Submits a grade for a selected student and module. Validates that both a student and module have been selected and a grade has been entered. If any input is missing or invalid, a warning alert is displayed. If the grade for the selected student and module already exists, the grade is updated; otherwise, a new grade entry is created.
      Parameters:
      selectedStudent - The student ID of the selected student.
      selectedModule - The module code of the selected module.
      gradeInput - The TextField containing the input grade.

    • delete

      public void delete(String id, String module)
      Deletes a grade entry for the specified student ID and module code. If the student ID or module code is not provided, a warning alert is displayed. If the specified grade does not exist, a warning alert is displayed.
      Parameters:
      id - The student ID.
      module - The module code.

    • comboBox

      public void comboBox()
      Populates the student ComboBox with student IDs and names. Fetches the students from the database and updates the observable list with the student ID and name in a formatted string.

    • comboBox_2

      public void comboBox_2(String id, boolean state)
      Populates the module ComboBox with module codes and names based on the state. If the state is true, all modules are fetched from the database. If the state is false, only modules that are available for the specified student ID are fetched.
      Parameters:
      id - The student ID.
      state - The state indicating whether to fetch all modules or only available modules for the student.

    • modifyCheck

      public void modifyCheck(String selectedStudent, String selectedModule)
      Checks if a grade exists for the specified student and module. If the grade exists, it sets the grade input field with the fetched grade. If the grade does not exist, it clears the grade input field.
      Parameters:
      selectedStudent - The selected student ID.
      selectedModule - The selected module code.

    • addModule

      public void addModule(javafx.scene.control.TextField name, javafx.scene.control.TextField code, javafx.scene.control.TextField currentSem)
      Adds a module to the database with the provided name, code, and current semester. Validates the module name, code, and semester before adding. If there are any validation errors, a warning alert is displayed.
      Parameters:
      name - The module name TextField.
      code - The module code TextField.
      currentSem - The current semester TextField.

    • removeModule

      public void removeModule(javafx.scene.control.TextField code)
      Removes a module from the database with the provided module code. Validates the module code before removing the module. If there are any validation errors, a warning alert is displayed.
      Parameters:
      code - The module code TextField.

    • listModule

      public void listModule()
      Retrieves the list of modules from the database and displays them in the 'list2' TextArea. The list of modules is cleared before fetching the updated list from the database.

    • search

      public void search(javafx.scene.control.TextField id, boolean statePassed)
      Searches for a student with the provided student ID and displays their grades. If the 'statePassed' parameter is true, only modules with passing grades will be displayed. If the student ID is invalid, a warning alert is displayed.
      Parameters:
      id - The student ID TextField.
      statePassed - A boolean value to determine if only passing grades should be displayed.

    • sort

      public void sort(javafx.scene.control.TextField id, String input, String sort)
      Sorts the displayed grades based on the provided input and sort order. The sorted list is then displayed in the 'list4' TextArea.
      Parameters:
      id - The student ID TextField.
      input - The column to be sorted in the SQL query.
      sort - The sort order (ASC or DESC) for the SQL query.

    • memoryLeak

      public void memoryLeak()
      Creates an infinite loop that will cause an OutOfMemoryError.
